alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Blair; Cambria; Huntingdon; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 1:47PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF BEDFORD...SOMERSET... BLAIR...CAMBRIA...AND HUNTINGDON COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 146 PM EDT, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from near Huntingdon to near Hollidaysburg to near Windber to Latrobe and moving southeast at 20 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Martinsburg, Ogletown and Roaring Spring around 150 PM EDT. Raystown Dam around 200 PM EDT. Entriken and Blue Knob State Park around 205 PM EDT. Shy Beaver around 210 PM EDT. Trough Creek State Park and Queen around 215 PM EDT. Osterburg and Mount Union around 220 PM EDT. * This includes the following Interstates... The Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 101 and 115... between mile markers 143 and 145...and from mile markers 185 to 186. Interstate 99 from mile markers 0 to 35. This includes the following highways... Route 22 between the Indiana County line and east of Canoe Creek State Park...and from Mill Creek to near Mapleton. Route 30 from the Westmoreland county line to Bedford. Route 219 from Somerset to near Ebensburg. Route 220 from near Cessna on I-99 to near Altoona on I-99. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
